info.title: Radarr
info.description:
The way users should interact with Radarr programatically. To utilize any of these endpoints you will need a few pieces of information:

ex: localhost:7878/api/v3/movies?apiKey={key_here}

* url: localhost, 10.1.0.1, 192.168.1.1, etc
* port: 7878 (unless you modify it)
* apiKey: Located in Settings > General > Security

get.description: Returns all movies stored in the database

parameters.name: tmdbId
parameters.description: TMDb id of the movie to get

requestBody.description: Movie object that needs to be added

post.description: Adds a movie to the database

requestBody.description: Movie object that needs to be edited

parameters.name: moveFiles
parameters.description: Have radarr move files when updating

put.description: Updates a movie in the database

get.description: Returns a single movie

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Database Id of movie to return

delete.description: Delete a single movie by database id

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Database Id of movie to delete

parameters.name: addImportExclusion
parameters.description: Add deleted movies to List Exclusions

parameters.name: deleteFiles
parameters.description: Delete movie files when deleting movies

get.description: Returns the id of all items in the database which use the specified tag
Returns a list of tag detail objects for all tags in the database.
Return a given tag and its label by the database id.

put.description: Edit a Tag by its database id

get.description: Get all tags in the database

post.description: Create a new tag that can be assigned to a movie, list, delay profile, notification, or restriction

requestBody.description: Tag object that needs to be added

get.description:
Query Radarr for disk usage information

Location: System > Status
Find out information such as OS, version, paths used, etc

value.message: Unable to communicate with qBittorrent. Failed to connect to qBittorrent, check your settings.

get.description:
Query radarr for health information

Location: System > Status

post.description:
Pushes commands to Radarr using a key:value pair. The main key is "name" and below are acceptable values but it can also accept other key:value pairs (listed under each command):

* ApplicationUpdate - Trigger an update of Radarr
* Backup - Trigger a backup routine
* CheckHealth - Trigger a system health check
* ClearBlocklist - Triggers the removal of all blocklisted movies
* CleanUpRecycleBin - Trigger a recycle bin cleanup check
* DeleteLogFiles - Triggers the removal of all Info/Debug/Trace log files
* DeleteUpdateLogFiles - Triggers the removal of all Update log files
* DownloadedMoviesScan - Triggers the scan of downloaded movies
* MissingMoviesSearch - Triggers a search of all missing movies
* RefreshMonitoredDownloads - Triggers the scan of monitored downloads
* RefreshMovie - Trigger a refresh / scan of library
    * movieIds:int[] - Specify a list of ids (comma separated) for individual movies to refresh

fixed: Importing completed downloads from NZBGet with post processing script failing
Importing of completed download when not a child of the download client output path

Will return a list of recent updates to Radarr

Location: System > Updates
Query Radarr for quality profiles

Returns blocklisted releases

ids.description: Database ids of the blocklist items to delete

Get Indexer by its database Id

parameters.description: Database id of the download client

delete.description: Delete a download client by database id

get.description: Get history for a given movie in database by its database id

put.description: Editor endpoint is used by the movie editor in Radarr. The Edit operation allows to edit properties of multiple movies at once

delete.description: Editor endpoint is used by the movie editor in Radarr. The Delete operation allows mass deletion of movies (and optionally files).

post.description: The movie import endpoint is used by the bulk import view in Radarr UI. It allows movies to be bulk added to the Radarr database.

get.description: The moviefile endpoint allows for retrieval of all moviefile by a list of ids or by the associated movieid. Either the moviefileids OR movieid query parameter must be passed.

parameters.name: moviefileids
parameters.description: Comma separated list of moviefile ids

parameters.name: movieid
parameters.description: Database id of movie to retrieve files for

get.description: Get a movie file object by its database id.

delete.description: Allows for deletion of a moviefile by its database id.

Get Settings for movie file and folder naming.

put.description: Edit Settings for movie file and folder naming.

delete.description: Remove an item from the queue and optionally blocklist it
Remove multiple items from queue by their ids

get.description: Get details of all items in queue
Stats on items in queue

post.description: Perform a Radarr "force grab" on a pending queue item by its ID.
